1.text: SARAH: There has been some days where I couldn’t

2.text:
even get dressed; life stops. You just want
it to go away.

10.text: SARAH: If you go on the internet and you try

13.text:
and look for information on cyber bullying
there is a lot but mainly for children and

18.text:
teenagers but there is nothing for adults
and it affects more adults than we actually

22.text: COMM: Fitness and beauty pageant organizer

24.text:
Sarah Donohue knows better than most how online
bullying can ruin lives.

29.text: PAT: She was at the top of her game and then

34.text: it all collapsed but we didn’t know why.

38.text: SARAH: When you are abused like this over

40.text:
the internet it’s very hard to describe
it, because a lot of people say you can just

43.text:
ignore it. You can’t ignore it. It’s with
you all the time. You know that when you turn

48.text:
the internet on it’s going to be there on
Twitter, it’s going to be there on Facebook

53.text:
and there is nothing that you can do to stop
it.

55.text: COMM: Before running pageants Sarah had been

59.text:
a champion in both power-boating and fitness
competitions and she was surprised at how

66.text: SARAH: I am naturally a very strong person;

69.text:
I am not the sort of person that I ever thought
could become a victim. This broke me. You

75.text:
know and if this can break me I think this
is why people really need to take note.

79.text: LEE: I was very surprised in the way it affected

82.text:
Sarah because in all honestly I had never
seen her cry before. We have been together

87.text:
for a couple of years at that point. I had
never seen anything affect her in this way.

93.text: SARAH: I was ashamed about being bullied because

96.text:
as an adult you shouldn’t really be bullied,
should you? You think this is something that

103.text: PAT: I can’t believe people could do things

105.text: COMM: Sarah was targeted by former contestants

109.text:
and associates after a disagreement about
the Miss Galaxy Universe competition she runs.

115.text: SARAH: In the first few days you just think

117.text:
‘Oh it’s silly, it will go away’. Then
it gets worse and then more people join in.

120.text:
You start getting threats. People start saying
really nasty things and then people that you

124.text:
don’t even know join in. They often say
that when you get one cyber bully, a cyber

129.text:
bully soon becomes a mob. They are keyboard
warriors; only when there is a keyboard involved

135.text:
they haven’t got the guts to be able to
say anything to your face.

138.text: COMM And after three months of enduring the

140.text:
abuse she and Lee felt they had no option
but to move home and postpone their wedding.

146.text: LEE: Some of the threats did actually suggest

148.text:
coming up to the house. Where we used to live
was in the middle of nowhere so quite vulnerable

152.text: SARAH: It just got so much we just kind of

155.text:
wanted a clean slate. We literally just packed
up and left.

159.text: SARAH: I cancelled my first wedding with Lee

163.text:
because we just couldn’t go through and
all my friends were saying ‘No Sarah, it’s

166.text:
okay. You can do it’. I said ‘No I can’t,
I can’t do it’.

169.text: LEE: How can you expect somebody to focus

171.text:
on what will be the biggest day of their life
when they can’t focus on anything else other

176.text: than the abuse she was getting online.

179.text: COMM: With cyber bullying on the rise, new

182.text:
UK legislation in 2014 means that perpetrators
can now face up to 2 years in prison.

191.text: COMM: After starting legal proceedings Sarah

194.text: received a 15,000 pounds out of court settlement.

199.text: PAT: She has got over it and she is happy,

201.text:
she is back on her feet and she is trying
to put her shows together again.

206.text: SARAH: I will never get bullied again on social

210.text: SARAH: I know all the warning signs. I know

212.text:
how to deal with it and I know how to nip
it in the bud, I know what to do. And after

216.text: that nothing can affect me again.

219.text: COMM: Now Sarah has married Lee and plans

223.text:
to fund a website to help other cyber bullying
victims.

228.text: SARAH: There is a lot of people out there

229.text:
that need to be helped but there is nowhere
for them to go. As soon as you become an adult

233.text:
and you stop being a teenager, where else
do they go? There is nowhere. Cyber bullying,
